overview_of_class: This first part of the three-quarter second-year course is a continuation of Arabic I, and moves students forward in all modes of language use, including additional exposure to representative regional spoken varieties, work on more sophisticated written expression and reading abilities for higher level/more abstract types of texts.
name: Arabic II
title: WCAS ARABIC 121-1-20 Arabic II

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This first part of the three-quarter second-year course is a continuation of Arabic I, and moves students forward in all modes of language use, including additional exposure to representative regional spoken varieties, work on more sophisticated written expression and reading abilities for higher level/more abstract types of texts.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: ARABIC 111-3, or equivalent determined through a placement exam.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: After completing the work on Al-Kitaab Part One, this quarter we will be continuing to work through Part Two to move from the intermediate level of proficiency to an advanced level of proficiency. By the end of the quarter, if you take the time to acquire vocabulary actively, you will be able to read a range of styles in Arabic, from formal to informal and journalistic to expository. You will also be able to read, write, and speak with increased grammatical accuracy and fluency.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Class time is devoted to conversation, reading, translation and structure exercise. Regular homework will play an important role in the students' development, so care should be taken that adequate time be allocated between class meetings for the completion of assignments

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Final grade for the course will be based on: attendance and participation, homework, quizzes, mid-term exam and final exam.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
1) Kristen Brustad, Mahmoud Al-Batal and Abbas al-Tonsi, Al-Kitaab fii Ta?allum al-?Arabiyya with DVDs: Part One. 3rd edition. [ISBN: 9781589017368 (1589017366)]

2) Kristen Brustad, Mahmoud Al-Batal and Abbas al-Tonsi, Al-Kitaab fii Ta?allum al-?Arabiyya with DVDs: Part 2 3rd ed. [ISBN 978-1-58901-747-4]

3) Companion websites ?students will be able to purchase access after the course starts and they have their books.

4) Arabic-English Dictionary: The Hans Wehr Dictionary of Modern Written Arabic by Hans Wehr, J. M. Cowan (Editor) 4th Edition (January 1993) ISBN: 0879500034
